translations: n.（公司员工的）工资名单；（公司的）发放工资总额；（公司员工的）薪资管理；受聘职员总数

sentences.sentence: All told there were 104 people on the payroll.
Before Harrington knew it, she was down to her last $20,000, not enough to cover payroll.
sentences.translation: 在哈林顿知道这件事之前，她只剩下最后的2万美元，还不够支付工资单。

sentences.sentence: I thought graduate teaching assistants will automatically put on the payroll at the beginning of the semester.
sentences.translation: 我原以为研究生助教会在学期开始时自动进入发放工资的名单。
